file_content.text: This is Watcher Two. I'm receiving your signal; transmission secure.
Nice to have you on a world with modern HoloNet transceivers--you're coming in loud and clear, Cipher Nine.
Status report.
I'll sum up what we know and let you judge for yourself.
Looking good yourself, Watcher Two.
[Flirt] Nice to see you.
It's the high-resolution holoprocessors. They make up for my defects.
So we can talk freely?
Good news.
As long as you don't mind being recorded for the archives.
Nice to know something is going right.
That's a small favor.
Ever the optimist.
Nar Shaddaa is one of the most densely populated city-worlds in the galaxy. It's also a major trade hub for criminals and corporations.
That's why the terrorists are here. The local cell procures weapons and technology for the Eagle's entire network.
If you're right, we need to cut off those supplies.
Then we'll stop them.
Agreed. But there's more to it than that.
What kind of technology?
Technology?
Everything from state-of-the-art computer equipment and starship parts to adrenals and combat armor.
Hardly a surprise, is it? Sounds like a terrorist's paradise.
That's obvious enough.
One of the perils of open markets. A reason to bring Nar Shaddaa under control, some day.
These terrorists aren't thugs--they're intelligent, coordinated and well hidden. I've contacted an asset who claims he can help locate them.
He's a former operative of ours, effective in his day. When he had to be retired, he was redesignated "Watcher X."
How did a Watcher leave Imperial Intelligence?
He was a Watcher?
What do you mean by "had to be retired"?
"Retired"?
There's something you're not saying.
You sound hesitant.
Watcher X was one of our most capable analysts, but he became paranoid--prone to seeing connections and conspiracies where none existed.
He was judged unstable and confined to Shadow Town--a Nar Shaddaa slum rebuilt as an open prison.
It's where the Empire holds people who know too much. People we might need later. That's all I'm authorized to say.
Send me coordinates and I'll pay him a visit.
Understood.
Done. Thank you.
There's more, isn't there? But you're not going to tell me.
Please don't hold back.
However... close we've been, the work takes precedence. And my work involves secrets.
If I'm risking my life, I'd like to know what's going on.
I need more information.
I'm sorry, but you don't have the security clearance.
I don't like any part of this.
This is garbage.
If there were another way, we'd take it. But he's our best resource.
Shadow Town residents are fitted with motion-tracking implants set to explode if they escape. This should keep Watcher X under control.
Nonetheless--don't underestimate him. Watcher Two out.
